MonsterTrait.Name: Amphibious
MonsterTrait.Text: The glass gator can breathe air and water.

MonsterTrait.Name: Lunge
MonsterTrait.Text: When the glass gator leaps at least 10 feet toward a creature and hits that creature with a claws attack on the same turn, it can immediately constrict the target as a bonus action.

MonsterTrait.Name: Transparency
MonsterTrait.Text: The glass gator has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater or in dim light.

MonsterTrait.Name: Standing Leap
MonsterTrait.Text: The glass gator can long jump up to 15 feet from water or up to 10 feet on land, with or without a running start.

MonsterAction.Name: Claws
MonsterAction.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and the glass gator can't attack a different target.

MonsterTrait.Name: Constrict
MonsterTrait.Text: One creature that's already grappled by the glass gator takes 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, or half as much poison damage with a successful DC 11 Constitution saving throw.

MonsterTrait.Name: Silt Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
MonsterTrait.Text: After taking damage while in water, the glass gator thrashes to stir up a 10-foot-radius cloud of silt around itself. The area inside the sphere is heavily obscured for 1 minute (10 rounds) in still water or 5 (2d4) rounds in a strong current. After stirring up the silt, the glass gator can move its speed.
